lines.text: This is my bride-trap.
Have you caught any brides?
You're the first one.
I don't need this anymore!
[pours wine over Regina's head]
Regina, queen of the bitches!

[speaking to a young dairy girl]
Go to the dance, and tell them that the Padroné is dead. Tell them that, and enjoy the dance.
What are you doing?
I'm screwing the earth.
I love the smell of earth!
That's dried shit.
Where's my father's gun?
I have hidden it.
You'd better be careful. If you don't use it, it gets rusty.

[in the cowshed]
My grandfather hanged himself in here, you know.
Never bite the hand that feeds you. As long you need to be fed.
I don't want anything to change from the way we are now!
Make me cum. Make me cum. Make me cum.
Come on, you can't cum. An elephant couldn't make you cum.
ALL I NEED IS A REAL MAN!

Alfredo Berlinghieri, you, and all parasites, will pay the bill for the Fascist revolution. And the bill will not be cheap. The bill will not be cheap. Everybody will pay! Everybody, rich and poor, gentry and peasant, they will pay with money and land and bread and cows and cheese and blood and shit!
You're not allowed in here.
Get away.
You don't learn easy, do you boy? You don't listen, do you?
Get away!
You've been told a hundred times you're not allowed in here!
[Grabs Olmo and shouts]
Don't you push me! Somebody's gonna teach you a lesson you'll never forget!

[to Alfredo]
You are the Padroné now. So send Attila away from here. Send him away, Alfredo!

[indicates their servants]
They are all related?
Yes. A whole family of Dalco's. They've been working this land for generations.

Alfredo takes a glass of wine]
Drink some wine, eh?

[pushes the glass away]
No, please, no.

[looks annoyed at Alfredo's persistence]
She doesn't want it.

[forces the wine into her mouth]
Drink, you little whore.
[Neve swallows, but soon goes into a seizure]
What the-?

[realization appears on his face]
Oh no, she's an epileptic!

[leading a procession with Anita down a street in the early morning]
Wake up! Wake up and come out!

[announcing the deaths of seven elderly Communists by arson]
All of them murdered by the Fascists! Murdered by the Fascists!
That's not a pussycat, that's a communist!
Do you know how to play the wedding game?

[attempts to organize the women]
All of you back to work!
Oh, look ladies, it's the rooster, come to shepherd the hens again! Cluck, rooster, cluck!
[leads women in throwing straw at a bemused Attila]
I know who killed the boy.
What? Who?
I saw from a distance who it was.

[intensely interested]
Who was it!

[walks away, starting to ramble]
I walk all day, I speak to all...
All those years in jail for nothing!
What the hell gives you the right to act like a missionary?

[Weaves drunkenly towards an irate Alfredo]
I know why you don't want me to drink. It's because when I drink it gives me the call to tell you the truth! You are different, you have changed. You are surrounded by terrible, vulgar, arrogant bullies, murderers... and you are even worse than they are!
November is the cruelest month of the year.

[Ada is drinking excessively in a small pub]
Merry Christmas.

[Knocks her drink out her hand]
You know how long I've been looking for you?
Signora Berlinghieri can no longer drink at home because the wine is locked away. She can no longer drink is smart cafes because her husband has given orders against it. So she drinks in taverns.

[Quiet but furious]
I'm going to have you locked up in an asylum.

[Crawls under the table]
I can drink here! I can even fall under the table. Nobody sees me anyway.
Get up from there. Get up. You look disgusting. Your face is all swollen from the alcohol, you stink. Get up!

[Wanders to other people in the tavern]
Do I disgust you too? Am I swollen? Do I stink?

[Runs into a screaming couple]
Fighting eh? Lucky you. I guess you love each other.

[Had just accused Olmo of hiding his wife]
I'm sorry, I don't know what's the matter with me. I don't know, I'm not feeling well, I think I have a heart condition.
[Grabs his hand]
Feel my heart.

[Knocks him away]
What heart? You're just sick in the head!
Maybe you're right. I don't know, I'm going crazy. Ada's gone and I can't find her.
And you come looking for her in my bed?

[Captured by the peasants who she had previously helped oppress]
Can you show no pity?
You slut. You like fooling around with everyone. Even Olmo.

[Mocking]
Olmo? What an imagination.
Is it my imagination to have seen you together? That I've seen you with him before? Is it my imagination that I smell him on you?

[Yells]
You think Olmo would have anything to do with the wife of a *fascist*?

[Screams]
Fascist? I am not a fascist! If you call me that again I will kill you! If I see you with him again I will kill you!
[last lines]
The Padrone's alive.

[after a big hailstorm]
What's happened? Lost your tongue, have you? Go head, tell them! How much grain have we lost? Tell them!
Half.
So, it's simple-you'll have to be satisfied with half pay. Take it or leave it.
When we harvest double we don't get double pay.

If I were to be honest, if I were to look after my interests alone, I should ditch you, fire the lot of you! Especially all you day laborers. And if you here weren't such an ignorant bunch, you would thank me! Because the one making the biggest sacrifice is me. What's the problem, anyway? Who gives the orders here? Who's the padrone? Hey you!
[points to the Peasant]
We've lost nearly everything, didn't you hear? And yet, your ears are both big enough!
[the Peasant cuts off one of his ears and hands it to him]
Long live Stalin!
[repeated line]
Milk and shit.
Signor Alfredo, together we salute you and your bride.
Get off the table.
You are a lucky boy, Olmo. You are.
Why?
Why? It took me 73 years to see an landlord working.
Maybe the truth is that when a man does nothing all his life, it leaves him too much time to think. And thinking too much makes him... makes him stupid.
